alert.note: Alert for Lake Mead NRA, Colorado River-AZ side; Northwest Deserts, Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 16 at 10:42AM MST until June 18 at 11:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT /11 AM MST/ TO 11 PM PDT /11 PM MST/ FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTHERN NEVADA AND NORTHWEST ARIZONA......FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTHERN NEVADA AND NORTHWEST ARIZONA... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTHERN NEVADA AND NORTHWEST ARIZONA......FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTHERN NEVADA AND NORTHWEST ARIZONA... * AFFECTED AREA...In Arizona...Fire weather zones 101 and 102.In Nevada...Fire weather zones 461, 462, 463, 464, 465, and 466. * TIMING...Critical fire conditions are primarily expected in thelate morning through early evening hours. * WIND...Sustained winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph. Stronger wind gusts possible across the Southern Great Basin. * HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity values of 5 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: Outdoor burning is not recommended. Heed all fire restrictions.

area.areaDesc: Lake Mead NRA, Colorado River-AZ side; Northwest Deserts, Northwest Plateau
